content:
/>
X.iv.2.B.3.a
.
Death as a Result of an Accident
A death may be considered accidental if the chain of circumstances resulting in the fatality was not set in motion for the purpose of causing death.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section B  - Considering Eligibility When Homicide Is Involved
citation: Part X, Subpart iv, Chapter 2, Section B
